page.title: 15OUR SCHOOL
page.content: In 1877 there was a Board school at Framwellgate Moor.It had one class for boys,one class for girls and one for infants.The pupils studied cookery,nature,gardening,history,geogr aphy,grammar,reading,writing and arithmetic.At first they wrote on slates but by 1882 copy books were used.In those days some children started school at the age of 9. The payment by results system was used.In 1880 the grant to the school was Â£126 but,in 1894,it was cut to Â£44 because of poor results.In 1881 the heating had been inadequate.The ink used by the pupils froze. By 1957 all children in the district attended the school.It continued to develop and today there are modern buildings housing infants,juniors and a comprehensive on one campus.
